comments.text:
It'd be cool if the Live CSS editor was able to locally save the CSS changes that a user performed to any webpage, and automatically load those changes every time for that webpage, thus providing a native Stylish/userContent.css functionality.

It could save the CSS files that were added, and (perhaps more complicated), save the diffs to the existing CSS files that were modified.

comments.text:
I would really love to have this feature.

What could it look like? An additional button in the editor might be too much. Maybe a context menu with a checkbox "automatically load this stylesheet". But then, how can the user tell for which URL this stylesheet should be loaded? In the comment of the style, like a userscript?

comments.raw_text:
(In reply to Paul Rouget [:paul] from comment #1)
> But then, how can the user tell for which URL this stylesheet
> should be loaded? In the comment of the style, like a userscript?

Stylish userstyles use @-moz-document domain/url/url-prefix selectors, and it's a much cleaner approach compared to metadata in comments IMO.

But I wonder, aren't we going to be creating a subset of Stylish? I think potential users of this feature already know about/use Stylish, and it does a pretty good job at it. I specially like the style manager integrated in the add-ons manager: http://cl.ly/D2Ok
